questions.question: What is the recommended development environment for building UI5 apps?

What do you need destinations for?
Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: For accessing remote OData services, for example on the SAP Gateway demo system ES5
To automatically identify the user?s time zone and preferences
To connect to cloud services or on premise systems in a secure and standardized way
To configure your cloud application for a specific data center and region

Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: Local development is not recommended in general.

questions.question: Where can you find official guides for UI5 concepts?

answers.answer: On the API Reference tab in the UI5 Demo Kit
On the Documentation tab in the UI5 Demo Kit

questions.question: Where can you look for detailed explanations about UI5 controls in the UI5 Demo Kit?

Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: It ensures your code is built according to best practices.
It ensures your code is clean and understandable.

questions.question:
For what can you use ESLint?
Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: To ensure code quality during development
To check the UI5 version an app is running against
To ensure code quality in continuous integration builds

questions.question: Who or what is "Rufus"?

answers.answer: Rufus is the name of one of the course instructors of week 1.
Rufus is the name of the openSAP learning platform.
Rufus is a validator script and your personal assistant for the course exercises.
Rufus stands for Recap Unit-For-Unit Statement and is the recommended principle of this course.

questions.question: How can you recover your exercise code if you cannot continue?

answers.answer: Ask Rufus for help, relax, and watch him fix your code.
You can find the complete code of each unit on the public GitHub repository.
The complete code of each unit is attached in section Downloads for the corresponding week.
You must delete your project and do everything again.

questions.question: What does it mean when some lines are marked in yellow in a code block in the handout of an exercise?

answers.answer: These lines need to be deleted in your own code block.
These lines deviate from what was shown in the unit video.
These lines need to be added or exchanged in your own code block.
These lines contain a hidden code challenge.

questions.question: Which script is loaded to bootstrap UI5?

In which files in the SAP Web IDE templates is asynchronous loading of components already included?
Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.
Which settings does every UI5 control have?

Which of the following statements are correct?
Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: The metadata of a control contains only its own metadata and its immediate parents' metadata.
Different control classes can inherit others.
Each control is a standalone part of the UI, which is independent from the rest.
There is no way to place controls in other controls.

questions.question: What does JSON stand for?
What kind of data binding syntax is used for the ?visible? property in the example above?

cinemaAddress}"/>
What kind of path is the binding path to the model in the example above?

movies/{movieId}/appointments/{appointmentId}

answers.answer: Routes are called from the bottom up.
Only the first route matching the pattern will be triggered.
All routes are called at the same time.

questions.question:
Which of the following are major product standards covered by UI5?
Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.
Where are the visual and interaction design concepts for the UI5 controls described?

answers.answer: In the SAP Fiori Design Guidelines

questions.question: You want to translate the control-related text elements of your UI5 app into Mexican Spanish. How do you have to name your resource bundle file?
Where is the component defined?

answers.answer: In a declarative way in the index.html file
In a relative way in the index.html file under the path configured in the neo-app.json file

questions.question: In which files is it a best practice to store the routing configuration?

What do you have to watch out for in terms of the major product standards when developing enterprise-grade UI5 apps?
Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: Nothing; the UI5 framework automatically ensures that all product standards are obeyed.
It is a best practice to store all texts in the UI of your app in a separate resource file, so they can be easily translated into other languages.
When using date formats in your app, you need to take care that the formatting and parsing consider country-specific settings.
As your app controls the HTML output and provides its own JavaScript code, it is in your responsibility to secure your app.
If you change the structure of UI elements from custom JavaScript, HTML, or CSS, you must make sure that this has no negative impact on the accessibility capabilities provided by the UI5 framework.

questions.question:
Which of the following binding types exist in UI5?
Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

When is it recommended to use a formatter?
Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: To make data more readable for humans
To control the data, no matter how trivial the formatting is
To add colors to an app to make the UI look nice
To convert the data type for one-way data synchronization

questions.question:
UI5 offers hash-based navigation. What benefit does this offer?
Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: The hash means that parameters are passed to the Component.js to initialize the new view.

Using hash-based navigation can allow the user to persist the intermediate state of the application to the URL hash, which can be used as deep-linking to start the application directly with the persisted state.
The hash means that the page is loaded directly, and no function is involved to load it.
The hash means that the browser does not have to reload the page but loads only the target view.
The hash directly retrieves the UI5 bootstrap and the dependencies, so loading times are optimal.

questions.question:
Which of the following statements concerning the predefined CSS classes in SAPUI5 are true?
Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: The class "sapUiMediumMarginBottom" should be applied to controls.
The class "sapUiResponsiveContentPadding" should be applied to controls.
The class "sapUiResponsiveContentPadding" should be applied to containers.
The class "sapUiMediumMarginBottom" should be applied to containers.

questions.question:
Which of the following statements about the theming concept in UI5 are correct?
Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: Apps built with UI5 can work with multiple themes.
Themes in UI5 cannot be modified.
There is only one theme delivered with UI5.
UI5 utilizes Sass as a preprocessor for its CSS.
The theming concept utilizes a simple LESS-based semantic parameter structure.

questions.question:

Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: Download the sources and build and run everything via UI5 tooling.
This is not possible in SAP Web IDE.
Download the sources and build and run everything in a Tomcat server.
Select index.html and right-click -> run as web application.

questions.question:

answers.answer: A toolkit to develop certain kinds of applications
An application layout defined by the SAP Fiori Design Guidelines
A combination of UI elements in a meaningful and standardized way

answers.answer: The data that is stored on the back end

A description of the resources like collections, entities, and properties of the OData service

questions.question: How many independent columns can be displayed in a flexible column layout?

Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.
Why is the "NotFound" view not connected to any other view in the Storyboard Editor?

answers.answer: It is handled in the "bypassed" section of the routing configuration, which is only called when a routing error occurred in the app.
The "NotFound" view is always called when the user logs out.
The "NotFound" view is always displayed before startup.
The "NotFound" view is the application's root view.

answers.answer: It is never rendered without a span.
It always contains exactly one property.

questions.question: How do you show the information from the "Navigation Property" once it has been extended for an EntitySet?

What is a navigation property?

answers.answer: A navigation property provides navigation in the application UI.
A navigation property defines a link from one entity to another.
A navigation property can be used for extending the OData request of an entity as a binding parameter.
A navigation property can be compared to relationships in a database system.
A navigation property is used to migrate data from one system to another.

questions.question: What is the purpose of SAP Web IDE's Storyboard Editor?

answers.answer: To display the data sources' metadata
To automatically generate translations of the application's resource files
To edit the application's user manual
To visually represent the application?s views and navigations

answers.answer: Do extensive configuration in application coding.

What is a fragment?

answers.answer: The same as a view, just without a controller
Root control of a UI component
Light-weight UI part which enables reuse of a combination of Controls
Controls contained in a specific section of a view

questions.question:

answers.answer: It can only be used once
It is a definition of data inside of an UIArea
It can be used as a navigation target
It is a declarative definition in XML
It is typically connected to a controller

questions.question: What can you do on UI5Lab.io?

answers.answer: Share, retrieve, and use UI5 custom control libraries.
Chat with your peers about the latest UI5 news.

questions.question: What ist the default binding mode for the ODataModel V2

Contact the control developers to enable drag and drop.

questions.question: Which element can be used within the dragDropConfig aggregation to enable only "Dropping"?

Which step in test-driven development is very important?

answers.answer: Writing three different sets of tests for each function and getting a positive result from at least 2 out of 3
Running the test to see if it fails before writing new functional code
Checking all variables that have names starting with "test"
Testing the application manually each time a new function is implemented

questions.question: What is a common way to execute the Karma test runner to test a UI5 application in a local development environment?

answers.answer: Execute "npm run karma" in the command line.

questions.question: To which level in the testing pyramid do OPA tests belong?

What are the advantages of using a mock server in component tests?
Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: To tunnel data requests through any firewall
To generate data randomly with each test run
To test the app?s functionality independently of the availability of the back end
To have stable and reliable data available for testing

questions.question: What is a journey in the context of OPA tests?

answers.answer: A journey defines the level for OPA tests in the testing pyramid.
A journey defines the maximum number of tests.
A journey is a sequence of tests that cover a special aspect of your application.
A journey transfers test results between individual tests.

questions.question: Which important file is produced by the self-contained build of the UI5 tooling?

answers.answer: To clear the dist folder before the start of the build process
To include the dependencies, which are required to build themes or make other resources such as i18n files available
To verify that all files paths are defined

answers.answer: The connection check to all OData services

questions.question: What is a common way to start unit tests for an application in SAP Web IDE?

answers.answer: Drag and drop the project's folder onto the test panel.
Right-click unitTests.qunit.html in the application's unit test folder and select "Run ? Run as Unit Test".
Click the "Test now!" button in the upper right corner.

questions.question: Which of the following is a recommended test runner when developing UI5 applications in a local development environment?

answers.answer: Actions prepare the application startup and initialization of the mockserver.
Actions tear down the app at the end of an OPA test.
Actions describe the simulated user interactions.

By specifying the sourceElement="listId" and the targetElement="IistId" within the DragDropInfo
By specifying the sourceAggregation="items" and the targetAggregation="items" within the DragDropInfo
By specifying only the targetAggregation="items" within the DragDropInfo

questions.question: Which of the following files is a place to instantiate models?
Which are the lifecycle hooks of every controller?
Which of the following statements is correct?

answers.answer: You cannot load any third-party (non-UI5) modules within your application using sap.ui.require or sap.ui.define.
You must define all resources on the top of your controller file using sap.ui.define, whether you will use them or not.
sap.ui.require and sap.ui.define always request dependencies synchronously.
You may require any resource during your controller execution asynchronously using sap.ui.require.

answers.answer: The device model can be used to detect the devices orientation.
The device model ensures that you get the same view on a mobile phone that you get on a desktop device.

answers.answer: A function is needed in the controller to apply the hash. Your Answer

questions.question:
What are the advantages of using the Descriptor Editor in SAP Web IDE for editing the manifest.json?
Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: Entries are structured and displayed in an orderly fashion so that it's easier to find a specific entry.
Typos can be avoided by value selection.
Developers get a better overview of the entries.
The manifest.json is an extremely complicated file, so programming into it directly is not possible.
The Descriptor Editor automatically translates the App Manual into 9 other languages.

questions.question:
Which statement about the relation between the controllers and the views used in the MVC pattern is correct?
Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: One controller can assist many views.
One view can exist without a controller to it.
One view can use many controllers.
The controller must be named exactly as the view.

questions.question:
Which of the following statements about sap.f.routingRouter when used with sap.f.FlexibleColumnLayout is correct?
Note: There are 2 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: The only difference between sap.f.routing.Router and sap.m.routing.Router is the library they are contained in.
sap.f.routing.Router offers an event which is fired before views are loaded into the respective columns of the FCL.
sap.f.routing.Router can have only have one target per route.
The sap.f.routing.Router view loading is exclusively asynchronous.

questions.question:
What is the significance of using sap.ui.require within a certain block of code to load library dependencies?
Note: There are 3 correct answers to this question.

answers.answer: It loads the dependencies only when it is required for a particular block of code.
It helps in reducing the payload size as the dependencies are required only for a particular block of code.
Dependencies are requested earlier than necessary.
